cfGW2SpidyAPI
Class cfGW2SpidyAPI

WEB-INF.cftags.component
        cfGW2SpidyAPI.cfGW2SpidyAPI

public class cfGW2SpidyAPI

extends WEB-INF.cftags.component

******************************************************************************* ColdFusion implemenation of the GW2 Spidy Public API Author: Don Quist Web: www.sigmaprojects.org Email: don@sigmaprojects.org Github: https://github.com/sigmaprojects/ GW2 Spidy: https://github.com/rubensayshi/gw2spidy/ https://github.com/rubensayshi/gw2spidy/wiki/API-v0.9 *******************************************************************************

private struct call(String Method, [Struct Args='[runtime expression]'], [String Verb='GET'], [String URIAppend=''])
 array getAllItems([String Type='all'])
          Get all Items Results are cached server side for up to 3 minutes
 array getDisciplines()
          Get all Crafting Disciplines Results are cached server side for up to 24 hours
 struct getGemPrice()
          Get Current Gem Price Results are cached server side for up to 15 minutes Prices are for 100 gold -> x amount of gems and for 100 gems -> x amount of coin
 struct getItem(String dataId)
          Get all Items Results are cached server side for up to 3 minutes If you need high frequency of updates, this is what you want to use (and what I want you to use!)
 struct getListings(String dataId, [String BuyOrSell], [Numeric Page='1'])
          Get Item Listings Results are cached server side for up to 15 minutes Data is ordered descending by date/time
 array getRarities()
          Get all Rarities Results are cached server side for up to 24 hours
 struct getRecipe(String dataId)
          Get Recipe Data Results are cached server side for up to 15 minutes
 struct getRecipes([String type='all'], [Numeric Page='1'])
          Get Recipes Results are cached server side for up to 24 hours
 array getTypes()
          Get all Item Types Results are cached server side for up to 24 hours Subtypes start their IDs from 0, for every top level type, following ArenaNet's design ;)
 struct itemSearch(String Name, [Numeric Page='1'])
          Search Items Results are cached server side for up to 15 minutes I strongly ask and encourage you, please use the getItem API method if at all possible! This API method is really ment for adhoc usage, not for bigger automated usage!

Version - API Version
Format - the default return format for responses (json/xml)

getAllItems

public array getAllItems([String Type='all'])
Get all Items Results are cached server side for up to 3 minutes

Parameters:
Type - either an ID of a top level type or use *all*

getDisciplines

public array getDisciplines()
Get all Crafting Disciplines Results are cached server side for up to 24 hours

getGemPrice

public struct getGemPrice()
Get Current Gem Price Results are cached server side for up to 15 minutes Prices are for 100 gold -> x amount of gems and for 100 gems -> x amount of coin

getItem

public struct getItem(String dataId)
Get all Items Results are cached server side for up to 3 minutes If you need high frequency of updates, this is what you want to use (and what I want you to use!).

Parameters:
dataId - the ID of the item you want to retrieve data for

getListings

public struct getListings(String dataId, [String BuyOrSell], [Numeric Page='1'])
Get Item Listings Results are cached server side for up to 15 minutes Data is ordered descending by date/time

Parameters:
dataId - the ID of the item you want to retrieve listings for
BuyOrSell - whether you want the sell or the buy listings, use singular and lowercase: sell or buy
Page - page offset

getRarities

public array getRarities()
Get all Rarities Results are cached server side for up to 24 hours

getRecipe

public struct getRecipe(String dataId)
Get Recipe Data Results are cached server side for up to 15 minutes

Parameters:
dataId - the ID of the recipe you want to retrieve data for

getRecipes

public struct getRecipes([String type='all'], [Numeric Page='1'])
Get Recipes Results are cached server side for up to 24 hours

Parameters:
type - either an ID of a discipline or use *all*
Page - page offset

getTypes

public array getTypes()
Get all Item Types Results are cached server side for up to 24 hours Subtypes start their IDs from 0, for every top level type, following ArenaNet's design ;)

itemSearch

public struct itemSearch(String Name, [Numeric Page='1'])
Search Items Results are cached server side for up to 15 minutes I strongly ask and encourage you, please use the getItem API method if at all possible! This API method is really ment for adhoc usage, not for bigger automated usage!

Parameters:
Name - the name of the item you're looking for
Page
